definition: flourishing reputation
flourishing/vigorous/magnificent/extensively
surname Sheng
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
to praise/to acclaim/reputation

sentences.english: Fruit-of Wudang Mountain in prestigious Ming Dynasty Wudang Mountain is the rare plant.
sentences.chinese: 武當山榔梅果在明代享有盛譽，是武當山的稀有植物。

sentences.english: In addition, Jolie was estranged from her famous father.
sentences.chinese: 此外，朱莉與她享有盛譽的父親出現不和。

sentences.english: The company has an excellent reputation for high-quality leather shoes.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司因其生產的高質量的皮鞋而享有盛譽。

sentences.english: It wins over by its absolutely amazing, very compact aroma of matured black currants.
sentences.chinese: 絕對迷人簡潔的成熟紅加侖芬芳令它得享盛譽。

sentences.english: Among them, " Barkhor street" is the most prestigious one.
sentences.chinese: 其中，“八廓街”在國內外享有盛譽。

sentences.english: The sale brought Mr Axford considerable publicity.
sentences.chinese: 這一拍賣爲埃克斯福特先生帶來盛譽。

sentences.english: The Lord of the Rings, a three volume fantasy adventure epic authored by J. R.
sentences.chinese: 《魔戒》，三卷奇幻史詩鉅著，作者是享有盛譽的J。

sentences.english: My school has long been enjoying a high reputation, and I have profited much from it.
sentences.chinese: 我的學校久已享有盛譽了，我由它得益很多。

sentences.english: He received recognition from both national and international bodies in the field of Tourism Economics.
sentences.chinese: 黃博士在馬來西亞國內和國際旅遊經濟領域享有盛譽。

sentences.english: Miu Yue was a famous critic in the research of Ci in the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 繆鉞先生是20世紀享有盛譽的詞學家。

sentences.english: He also has long enjoyed a reputation as being hugely charming andseductive.
sentences.chinese: 迷人和性感這樣的盛譽他也已經享有很久了。

sentences.english: He is the rare businessman with legitimate worldwide celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是少數幾個在全世界都享有盛譽的商人。

sentences.english: The occupancy of domestic market comes up to more than 30%.
sentences.chinese: “飛龍”牌運動護具，在國內外市場享有很高盛譽。

sentences.english: It has enjoyed good reputation in Europe market.
sentences.chinese: 它們在歐洲市場已經享有盛譽。

sentences.english: As you see， our products are enjoying a good reputation all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 如你們所知，我們的產品在世界各地享有盛譽。

sentences.english: The Mournes are internationally renowned for their picturesque scenery.
sentences.chinese: 莫恩山脈如畫的景色在國際上享受盛譽。

definition: evaluation/assessment
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to acclaim/to sing the praises of
to make a name/to become famous
out of the ordinary
painting world/painting circles
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
founder/creator/author
see 蔚成[wei4 cheng2]
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
to load into/to record/to write into/to enter (data)/to go into (the records)/to go down (in history)
to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
authoritative/(having) authority
a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
